TopicTitle: How do i become a moderator?

Articles.Content: I don\'t know why but what does it take to be a moderator for the forums? I\'m not asking for it or anything But i have alot of practice with forums LIKE this one

The Admns aren\'t recruiting new moderators now. You\'d have to be recruited, but since we don\'t need any more moderators, it\'s unlikely. You\'d have to be well-behaved, know the rules, be able to enforce them, a number of other things as well.
If you\'re going to try for Moderator i\'d consider touching up your English a bit more.
I didn\'t want to be rude, but yeah, he\'s right. Fix your typing.

The initial set of moderators was selected by HarvesteR/Squad after an open request was made. After a few days the offer was closed and the moderator team was announced.

At this point no moderators have resigned or been removed so I think it\'s safe to say there is no need for additional applications. At such time in the future another moderator is needed, a post will be made and/or the current team will be asked to make suggestions.

The best thing you can do now is actively participate in the forums, show a good grasp of game knowledge, and show you can communicate clearly with good English and grammar skills.

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

Yeah you just dont become a mod. Its usaly in house and proven. I am the only mod on a busy forum for a webcomic and thats just because I fit two things. I have been a fan from the start, mod after three years, its been 10 years and I havnt burned the forum down. I would like more mods.....however I would ban anyone that became mod from choice of people in the forums because I would not give one of them power.

So if you fit the needs of the forum and when the forum needs, You could be the a Mod...but they have to want you, not the other way round.
